intro: Cordia areolata, commonly known as the spotted cordia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in humid, lowland areas. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, rounded leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a round, fleshy capsule that splits open to release small, hard seeds. Cordia areolata is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
